被指篤數 曼城或被禁出戰

【now.com體育】早前曼城被指誇大贊助收入以規避財政公平競技規則，歐洲足協官員周五表示，一旦指控屬實，曼城或會被禁參與歐洲賽。

歐洲足協的財政公平競技首席調查員拉特馬（Yves Leterme），接受比利時一本雜誌訪問時說：「假如有關曼城的指控屬實，問題將會十分之嚴重。曼城或會受到重罰，不能參加歐洲足協旗下的賽事。」

去年11月，德國《明鏡周刊》刊登多篇文章，當中引用球會內部電郵，指曼城、摩納哥、巴黎聖日耳門利用各種手段，規避歐洲足協的財政公平競技規則。其中曼城被指利用贊助商名義注資的手段，增加曼城帳面上的贊助收入，做到收支平衡，實際上這些所謂贊助收入，很大部份是班主蒙蘇自己的錢。不過，當時曼城否認有關指控。

曾擔任比利時首相的拉特馬解釋，一家球會向歐洲足協申請參與賽事時，必須如實交待球會的財政狀況，而歐洲足協有關部門會隨機稽核球會提交的數字與帳目，「假如報道屬實，曼城違反了如實交待財政狀況的規定。」他說。

曼城已有前科，2014年曼城與PSG同因違反財政公平競技規則，各被歐洲足協罰款4900萬鎊，假如再犯，的確可能不只是罰款了事這樣簡單。

NEWS Kevin De Bruyne ‘angry’ with Pep Guardiola after being subbed against Burton – report


Kevin De Bruyne went straight down the tunnel after being substituted off against Burton Albion in Wednesday’s Carabao Cup semi-final first leg, raising fears that he might have another injury problem.

However, according to Paul Hirst of The Times, KDB wasn’t injured but rather angry at the decision to remove him quite early in the second half.

It is claimed that De Bruyne wanted to play longer in order to improve his match fitness after returning from injury, and was angry at Pep Guardiola for taking him off just 13 minutes into the second half.

Despite his out of character behaviour, it isn’t thought to be a major issue and De Bruyne is likely to make just his second Premier League start of the season next Monday when City host Wolves, a side who have made a habit of getting good results against top sides.

Sergio Aguero has also recovered from a bout of the flu and is expected to be fit to face Wolves.

replies.msg:
West Ham United youngster Declan Rice's latest comments look concerning

West Ham United fans may have reason to be slightly concerned after Declan Rice’s latest comments to the official website, amid rumours of Manchester City’s interest.

The Sun claim that City are lining up a bid for the West Ham midfielder, who Pep Guardiola has already spoken positively about this season.

And Rice’s comments on wanting to win the Champions League and play at the top level ‘throughout’ his career do seem to give some reason for concern.

“I want to play at the top level throughout my career,” he confirmed. “I want to win trophies, even the Champions League. You have to be ambitious. If not, what’s the point?”

If Rice does have a burning desire to win trophies like the Champions League then a move away from West Ham to Manchester City would have to appeal.

City are among the leading contenders to win European football’s top prize this season, and have turned themselves into a footballing superpower.

West Ham, of course, have just tied down Rice to a new contract - so they will be able to demand a huge fee for their prized prospect.

And although it seems highly unlikely that Rice will try and force a move away from West Ham, given his obvious loyalty to the club, his latest comments may just hint that a move to City would appeal to the youngster, if it became a possibility.

又買青訓龍練去賣
Young goalkeeper to arrive at Man City in the coming weeks – on one condition

Manchester City are set to bring forward the arrival of highly-rated Irish goalkeeper Gavin Bazunu from Shamrock Rovers – on one condition.

The 16-year-old was confirmed to be joining City in October, but the plan was for him to remain at Shamrock Rovers until the summer of 2019 to allow him to complete his Leaving Certificate.

However, reports from Ireland today say City want Bazunu earlier and he should arrive in the coming weeks, provided arrangements can be made that allow him to complete his Leaving Certificate in Dublin.

City want to place the Ireland youth international into their developmental system and build on his enormous potential, which saw him keep four clean sheets in a row last year for Shamrock Rovers and feature against AIK Stockholm in the Europa League qualifiers.

The Premier League champions are paying around €500,000 (£450,000) for Bazunu and will hope he continues the fine tradition of producing quality goalkeepers at the club.
